content.content: Click Settings allows you to edit the properties of individual clicks, as well as song-wide properties.

Vol: how loud each click is. 
Time  Rand: how much randomness to inject into click timing
Pitch Rand: how much randomness to inject into click pitch
A/D  ratio: what percentage of the subclicks are rising, and what percent is falling. For example, an A/D ratio of .2 will mean all subclicks increase to full volume in 20% of their length, and then fall back to 0 volume in the remaining 80%.
The next three parameters tie the current volume and randomness of a song to the speed at which clicks are being generated. This prevents initial clicks from being unnaturally loud at the start of songs, or sounding too robotic.
Floor Freq: The cutoff frequency for the fadeout and jitter effects. This is the frequency at which those things stop. Useful for making it sound more realistic.
Start Jitter: How much randomness to add below the floor frequency. 
Start Fade: How much to fade off the volume under the floor frequency.
